definitions.definition: used to show that you are grateful to somebody for something they have done
definitions.sensetop: thanks for doing somethingthanks for something

examples.text: ‘How are you?’ ‘Fine, thanks *(= thanks for asking)*.’
Thanks for lending me the money.

definitions.definition: a polite way of accepting something that somebody has offered you

examples.text: ‘Do you want to come with us?’ ‘I’d love to, thanks.’

definitions.definition: a polite way of refusing something that somebody has offered you

wordOrigin: Old English thancas, plural of thanc ‘(kindly) thought, gratitude’, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch dank and German Dank, also to think.
